name: Expand Delhi's Civilian Industry
description: The state of our industry is lacking. We should concentrate our efforts on researching new designs for our factories.

name: The Indian Economy Act
description: Our new Prime Minister has decided to enact a major economic reform act. It is expected to encounter debate and resistance in the Chamber of Princes, however.

name: Reforming the Industry
description: Our new government has decided to draft an industry rights reform act.

name: Expand Mines
description: In order to fuel our factories, we must expand our mines. New technologies will help us with this.

name: Expand the Indian Rail Network
description: The Indian rail network was once the jewel of the British Empire. We must restore it to that condition.

name: Continue to Restore Rail Networks
description: While our work extending the rail networks has been successful so far, we must continue it if we are to be able to move and supply our troops well.

name: Start Building Civilian Factories
description: Armed with new technologies, we can start building factories across our nation.

name: Continue Building Civilian Factories
description: We must continue to build civilian factories, to provide for our people.

name: Finish Building Civilian Factories
description: We must complete our civilian factory expansion to ensure even in years to come we can provide for our people.

name: Start Expanding Military Factories
description: Our military factories are currently lacking. We must dedicate our political efforts to expanding them.

name: Continue to Expand Military Factories
description: While our military production has increased, it is not nearly at a level necessary to take on the Bharatiya Commune and the Princely Federation. We must continue to expand it.

name: Finish Military Expansion
description: With a little more effort, we should be able to increase our military production to a respectable level.

name: The New Economy
description: At long last, we have put our reputation as a backwater aside and may now truly claim to be a rising industrial power, ready to take on our enemies.

name: Join the ISAC
description: By joining the Imperial Scientific and Academic Council, we will be able to greatly expand our research potential through funding and information sharing.

name: Benefits from the ISAC
description: We have received even more information from the ISAC, including blueprints for the construction of computing and census tabulating machines.

name: Encourage Immigration of ISAC Scientists
description: By encouraging ISAC scientists to come to India, we can greatly increase our research output.

name: Cross-Discipline Research
description: Our expanded industry, army, and scientific infrastructure have allowed even more technological development.

name: ISAC Rocketry Programme
description: The ISAC have started developing a rocketry programme. We should join as well, as this weapon has huge military benefits.

name: Start Reforming the Army
description: Our army is in poor shape. Divided between White and Indian officers and princes, and lacking in direction, we must try to unite the army to combat Syndicalism and the reactionary princes to the south.

name: The Question of the Princely Armies
description: The armies of Delhi are divided among regular divisions and the private armies of the Maharajas. This hampers communication and effectiveness in combat, and we must find a solution before it is too late.

name: Address the Diarchy
description: Our most urgent issue is the status of administrative governance which have languished under the ancient relic of the diarchy - dual rule over the provinces shared between the officials of the central government and the domains of the many princely states. The premier is under great pressure to do away with the archaic system of indirect rule in favour of more efficient and democratic local administration.

name: Choosing Doctrines for our Army
description: We must chose a direction for our army. Should we emphasise speed and armoured vehicles, firepower, or sheer manpower? Our officers are now debating the best course of action.

name: Motorising the Indian Army
description: India is a huge country, with a wide range of climates, from deserts to jungles. We must motorise our army so it is more mobile and able to respond to threats quicker.

name: Indian Armoured Corps
description: Providing our troops with armoured vehicles will give us a distinct edge in facing off against our enemies.

name: Expanding the Indian Armoured Corps
description: We must continue to expand our armoured corps, to maintain a competitive edge against our enemies.

name: Modernising the Sepoys
description: Indian infantrymen are numerous and loyal. Their equipment, however, is dated and inefficient. We must rectify this.

name: Modernising Delhi's Artillery
description: Delhi's artillery mostly dates from the Weltkrieg. We must modernise our artillery unless we wish our soldiers to be eviscerated without proper support.

name: Expanding the Gurkha Regiments
description: The Gurkhas are the most feared soldiers in the world. We must ensure that their equipment is up to date and their training sufficient for their missions.

name: Rule the Ground
description: Our primary focus is on our army - yes, this may come at the expense of our navy and air capabilities, but the Dominion of India must recognise where its strength lies and maximise its effectiveness.

name: Expanding the Imperial Indian Navy
description: Our navy is in a laughable shape. With no real military dockyards, we cannot produce any ships. We must dedicate all our political effort to creating the infrastructure necessary to maintain a navy.

name: Purchase Canadian Ships
description: Canada has a number of old vessels which they have long since retired from use, but which might still be useful in bolstering our tiny navy. Perhaps we should offer to purchase them?

name: Flexible Navy Focus
description: Our navy should be flexible, and able to respond to a wide variety of problems.

name: Large Navy Focus
description: We should ensure our navy is as large as possible, to overwhelm our enemies.

name: Submarine Focus
description: Submarines are an excellent way to disrupt enemy convoys. We should construct as many as possible.

name: Cruiser Focus
description: Cruisers are effective at many naval tasks, including both convoy raiding and escort duty.

name: Destroyer Effort
description: Destroyers are effective at destroying enemy submarines. We should ensure our shipping is safe by constructing as many of these as possible.

name: Capital Ship Effort
description: Capital ships, including battleships and carriers, are the kings of the seas. We must build large numbers of these to intimidate our enemies.

name: Rearm the Royal Indian Marine
description: As trade between the newly unified Indian subcontinent and the rest of the world begins to accelerate, the security of Indian shipping has become a most urgent matter. The naval chief of staff and admiralty in Karachi have petitioned the prime minister with pleas to secure development aid from our allies so that Indian commerce can penetrate the high seas adequately escorted.

name: Rule the Seas
description: Our primary focus is on our navy - yes, this may come at the expense of our army and air capabilities, but the Dominion of India must recognise where its strength lies and maximise its effectiveness.

name: Expanding the Royal Indian Air Force
description: Our air force is laughably small. We must focus our efforts on expanding it to ensure domination of the skies.

name: Indra Lal Roy Offers his Services
description: Legendary Weltkrieg ace Indra Lal Roy has offered his services to the new Indian air force, and is proving himself as able a theoretician as he is a pilot.

name: Fighter Focus
description: We should focus on building fighters, to keep the air clear of enemies.

name: Bomber Focus
description: We should focus on building bombers, to destroy our enemies from above!

name: Continuing to Expand the RIAF
description: The RIAF needs to be expanded even more, to ensure complete air supremacy.

name: CAS Effort
description: Close air support allows us to strafe enemy units during battles with frightening accuracy, giving us a large edge on our opponents

name: Naval Bomber Focus
description: Naval Bombers allow us to destroy enemy navies without risking our own ships. We should build as many of these as possible if our navy is small or busy elsewhere.

name: Expand the Indian Air Force
description: With our unification of the Indian sub-continent, it has been proposed in parliament that we convey a greater amount of funds towards the Indian Air Force in order to construct an air armada capable of covering the nation in its entirety.

name: Rule the Air
description: Our primary focus is on our air force - yes, this may come at the expense of our navy and ground capabilities, but the Dominion of India must recognise where its strength lies and maximise its effectiveness.

name: Preparing for the Final Struggle
description: It is inevitable that we will face both the Bharatiya Commune and the Princely Federation at some point in the near future. We should ensure we are as strong as possible before proceeding.

name: Continuing Preparations for the Final Struggle
description: Now that our immediate sphere is secure, we must prepare for war soon, on our terms or theirs...

name: Fortify the Princely Border
description: Our first order of business in the coming war is to secure our southern border. Only from a proper line of fortresses can we strike our against the Princely Federation.

name: Fortify the Bharatiya Border
description: Our first order of business in the coming war is to secure our southern border. Only from a proper line of fortresses can we strike our against the Commune.

name: Retake Calcutta
description: The eastern states based around Calcutta are rightfully a part of the Dominion, and we must retake them by force.

name: Incite Rebellion in the East!
description: Our intelligence services have kept in contact with loyalist rebels hiding in the foothills of the Himalayas. We should reach out them and have them stage a revolt in Assam, to free up our troops in the west.

name: Retake Hyderabad
description: The Deccan states are rightfully a part of the Dominion, and we must take them back by force.

name: Incite Rebellion in the South!
description: The new Maharaja of Cochin has Imperial loyalties. If we could convince him to join us it would free up our troops to attack from the north, while Princely troops try to suppress his rebellion.

name: Unify India!
description: Jai Hind! The subcontinent is once again ours! Now what?

name: The Deccan States
description: The nations of southern India must either join India willingly or be conquered - the choice is theirs.

name: Dealing with Bhutan
description: With our control over the India Subcontinent secure, it is time to look to our northern border. New great powers are rising in China, and the Himalayas are once again the forefront of a new great game. We must reassert our control over our old allies in Bhutan, whether it be by treaty or by force.

name: Our Claims Against Nepal
description: Nepal expanded into the Indian lowlands in the chaos following the Weltkrieg. It is time to reassert our domain over those territories.

name: The Burmese Territories in Siam
description: The Siamese Kingdom was one of the more opportunistic of the 'Vulture States' that exploited the disorder of the Raj's demise. With the young Burmese nation hard-pressed by the socialist uprisings in Assam and Bengal, the government of Siam simply occupied several districts and prefectures, including the city of Moulmein - mentioned in Kipling's famous poem. These lands must be returned!

name: Claim Goa
description: The enclave of Goa is nothing more than a burr on the side of our proud nation. It is rightfully our territory, and must be returned.

name: Claim Ceylon
description: By rights, Ceylon, the Maldives and the Andaman Islands are part of our nation's rightful territory. Their colonialism must come to an end.

name: Incorporating Burma
description: The eastern realm of Burma was once part of the Raj, and the time has come to incorporate it into our expanding realm.

name: The Bombay Plan
description: A new proposal for industrial development has emerged in the Dominion Legislature. Called the Bombay Plan, this will have large effects on our economy.

name: Indian Cinema: Propaganda Machine?
description: The vibrant Indian cinema scene has the possibility to be a powerful tool of the state, and while movies are still mainly a toy of the rich, they have wide reaching social effects.

name: A New India Arises
description: All India is no longer divided into three parts and the Delhi government stands triumphant from the Khyber Pass to the Bay of Bengal. From Calcutta to Hyderabad the legitimacy of the Delhi government has been accepted by the many peoples, castes and religious groups of the Indian nation. Now it is time for India to march towards the future united and forever indivisible!

name: Princely India's Officer Corps
description: The first order of business is dealing with the officers of the defeated Princely Federation. Do we give them a place in our nation? Or retire them before they can make further trouble?

name: Integrate the Former Bombay Presidency
description: We have brought about the complete collapse of the princely state and established control over the southern-most part of the sub-continent. Now, however, we must decide how to integrate the provinces previously ailing under feudal rule.

name: Integrate the Deccan Princely States
description: The southern princely states were always somewhat politically detached from the federal government in Hyderabad. This makes it harder for us to establish an efficient central administration. Never the less, that is what we will have to achieve.

name: Socialist India's Officer Corps
description: The first order of business is dealing with the officers of the defeated Bharatiya Commune. Do we give these socialists a place in our nation? Or retire them before they can make further trouble?

name: The Question of Industry
description: The Bharatiya Commune relied on nationalised industry, and its business leaders are now turning to us to answer the question regarding what they should do now - the answer for which will determine just how easy it will be for us to pacify the Commune's former heartland.

name: Fate of Assam's Tea Plantations
description: The vast tea plantations of Assam have functioned as state owned entities until the downfall of their socialist rulers. Now they are suffering, and we must settle the question of what is to be done with them if we are to solidify our rule over the region.

name: Fate of the Zamindar Squatters
description: There are a large number of exiled princes who wish to resume their estates in Orissa, now that the socialists have been defeated. Doing so will, however, mean evicting those who have taken over their lands. The question will need to be settled if we are to solidify our rule over the region.
